question: 恵む
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>favor</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to do a favor</vocabulary> for.
sourceReadingMnemonic: If you are going <vocabulary>to do a favor</vocabulary> for anyone, it's going to be for your good buddy <reading>meg</reading> (<ja>めぐ</ja>). Imagine a Meg you know (or know of) and imagine yourself doing a favor for her. Meg Ryan is so happy you're in her life.
